story:
DO YOU THINK THESE BEAUTIFUL VILLAGERS DESERVE ELECTRICITY?

When was the last time you stayed one whole day without electricity (barring your trekking trips)?

Without electricity, could you take bath in winters, reheat your food, work on computer, recharge your mobile, watch TV, listen to radio, wash clothes, use cooler/ AC/ laptop? 

Can you have banks, shops, restaurants, hotels, markets, cinemas, petrol pumps, cars, railway stations, factories without electricity? 

Without light in your life during evenings and nights - can you sleep, study, go to toilet, go out in streets, eat food (without Candle Light Dinners)? Can you survive easily? 

No ice creams. No night life. No internet - No Google, No Facebook. No metro trains. 

The villagers in Zanskar (Ladakh, India) have been doing exactly that. They haven't seen electricity in their lives and have not been able to most of the things comfortably. They cannot study to get a good job like us and cannot operate computers or mobiles like you are doing right now. 

And yet we all take electricity for granted. Can we do something about this? 

My campaign gives you the opportunity to get light in the lives of your fellow Indians in the 2550-year-old Phuktal Gonpa (Monastery) in Zanskar valley in Ladakh, J&K. Read More below:

CLICK ON 'BACK IT' NOW, AND CONTRIBUTE NOW FOR THE ELECTRIFICATION OF THE VILLAGE. 

**NEFT Details given at the bottom**

Every Rupee/ Dollar contributed by you shall help them in following ways:

  1. Women shall be able to cook the dinner at ease in the evening. 
  2. The kids can play till late evening.
  3. Men and women can work for more hours in the extra light and earn more. 
  4. Students can study for more hours, and do more activities.
  5. Kids can think of a better career/ jobs after they have more time to study. 
  6. Whole Community can sit together in the evening for celebrations, religious chantings etc. 
  7. The society can have more efficiently working banks, factories, shops etc. 
  8. Work that gets mechanized with electricity saves hundreds of man-hours which can be utilized for much better things. 


The Phuktal Electrification project shall entail the following activities:

  • Setting up Solar micro-grid for the Phuktal Monastery and Lighting it up for the first time! (Details available on request). GHE is IEEE accredited expert for DC Solar grid. 
  • Interaction with change-makers of Ladakh
  • Experiencing the sustainable livelihood of the Ladakh civilization
  • Buddhist meditation and yoga sessions

I, We & Ourselves:

"You live life only once..."
This is the philosophy I follow in my life, based on which I try to maximize the utility of my life. I try a lot of different things, and now with GHE I am going to explore an altogether new dimension of Social Work under extreme conditions and in a remote area. 
Professionally, I am a 8-year experienced CSR leader and a Marketing guy with Gi Group (an organisation known globally for its CSR initiatives). I love adventure travel, am a nature conservationist and enthusiast, love reading, helping, meeting people. Ping me: 9899144024. 



How you can help this monastery/ village see light for the first time?

  1. DONATE. Click on "Back It". 
  2. Share this cause with people in your network/ friends/ colleagues. 
  3. Share this on your Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram accounts etc. to spread awareness about the monastery that's waiting for electrification.
  4. Ask people to save electricity, use solar power where possible. 
  5. Share my mails further with people/ agencies who can back this project. 
You can surely make the right noise about this. Use the Facebook and Twitter links given on this page.  

Why am I giving out Perks? 

I want to give out perks for your contributions primarily because I want you to have memories and memorabilia associated with this event- extremely important for those whose lives are being enlightened. 
Check out the highly enticing and tantalizing perks including T-shirts, Fridge magnets, personal videos, mentions on Blog, private screening of Docu-photo series among others. 

Here's my Cost Break-Up for You and what I need from you:
I shall need INR 256,800/ USD 3846 (Indiegogo to charge me INR 16800/ USD 252 as commission on 210,000/ USD 3155). 
Out of this, I shall put INR 30000 / 450 USD from my own earnings. 
Here is the bifurcation: 

About GHE:
 

Global Himalayan Expedition (GHE) is an impact initiative that focuses on providing clean energy and education access to promote sustainable and inclusive progress in remote off-grid communities across the Himalayan ranges of north India.

GHE held its inaugural Expedition in August 2013, in Leh, Ladakh (India) located at 12000 ft. where the team of 25 Expedition participants representing 9 countries set up an Education Base (E-Base); a 100% solar powered facility comprising of a digital library, tablets, internet and various other learning tools to enable cross-cultural learning between the local kids and the outside world. 

Lack of access to electricity has been one of the major challenges faced by the remote Himalayan communities. In the past 2 years, GHE has been focusing on creating sustainable off-grid power generation solutions for these remote villages, some of which are thousands of years old, and located at an altitude of over 12000ft. GHE has till date electrified 10 villages, setup 30 microgrids, and has impacted over 2000 lives in the process. 

NDTV (Telecast): A Himalayan Expedition that helps illuminate Remote Villages

Huffington Post: Lighting up Himalayan villages

The Hindu: Lighting Himalayan villages 

Times of India: Sunrise after Sundown 

Financial Express: Taking Adventure Tourism to Next Level


 CONTACT 

Please feel free to contact me for any queries/ suggestions through any of the following means: 

Nimesh Sharma
M: +91 9899144024 (SMS/ Whatsapp/ Call)/ +91 120 4284986 (Home)
E: nimeshmarsboy@gmail.com (Chat/ Mail)
SKYPE: nimesh.sharma

FACEBOOK: www.fb.me/nimesh
LINKEDIN: www.bit.ly/nimesh


*** NEFT/ Bank Account Details: ***

Name : NIMESH SHARMA

A/C NO : 061001515231

Bank : ICICI BANK 

Branch : VAISHALI

IFSC CODE : ICIC0001254

MMID: 9229336

Thanks a lot , please mention your name in the transaction.

POWERED BY :

story:
Short Summary

Frostbites opened in 2014 in the Food Lion Shopping Center. We are a local independent business. Frostbites provides Frozen Yogurt and Hershey's Ice Cream with lots of topping for your frozen treats.

Frostbites is struggling and will not be able to stay open without your support.

The purpose of this campaign is to raise enough money to cover the operating costs for the remainder of it's lease so that it will have the chance to remain open. By raising this money it will relieve the burden of these expenses and allow the business to get ahead and survive.

We feel that we are an important part of this community and want to remain that way. We support many local causes and especially our schools. 

Without your help we will not be able to stay open.

We are adding some perks for those who donate so take a look at all the options. If you can't help, would you please share this with everyone so we have a fighting chance?

story:
WHAT IS LUMIIVA?

LUMIIVA is an innovative platform that lets you try out the latest tech gadgets. Experience innovation firsthand and make smart decisions about where to invest.

[OUR MISSION]

"OFFERING YOU THE MOST ENJOYABLE EXPERIENCES, WITHOUT COMPROMISING QUALITY AND AFFORDABILITY."


HOW DOES IT WORK?

   

 


LUMIIVA PACKAGES - PREORDER NOW!

These packages will be available when we launch in the Summer of 2016


OUR BENEFITS







BUYER'S JOURNEY


LUMIIVA will change your buyer's journey by allowing you to experience smart technology and gadgets BEFORE making investments in them! And the best thing about it: We transfer all of the necessary knowledge to you in order to provide you with the best experience - That means you do not have to research on the products by your own. And when you like the product, you can buy it, but when not - Just return it.



INSURANCE & SAFETY: WHAT WE OFFER

The products we sell provide a variety of benefits and enjoyments; But, we know that some of our products are fragile and we value the customers’ and products’ safety while enjoying the new experiences. Therefore, we offer:

   

   Highest quality and safety guidelines for suppliers

   Continuous quality and safety controls

  Optional insurance cover for every package

   Tips, tutorials and workshops on how to use our products


HOW THE MONEY WILL BE USED


              



LUMIIVA TIMELINE

                        





Q&A


Q:  What is inside each package offered?

A: The product chosen plus all the necessary equipment to experience it


Q: Am I limited to renting only these packages offered?

A: No. We keep up with technological trends and will seek to offer the most innovative products on the market. All suggestions from our customers will be welcome, and we will work with providing products that are in popular demand.


Q: I tried a gadget from LUMIIVA. Can I also buy it?

A: Of course! With your collected LUMIIVA Points that you earned for your rental period, you will even get a discount on the purchase price.


Q: How can I partner or work with you?

A: We are open to collaborate with different businesses! Please email us at lumiiva.info@gmail.com


Q: How can I get in touch with you for questions, suggestions or solely boredom?

A: Just get in touch with us via lumiiva.info@gmail.com or directly via our social media links 


                                                    


MEET THE TEAM


               


"LUMIIVA aims to solve a simple problem: The need to get hold of smart technology and gadgets on a temporary basis at an affordable price. Adapting to the current trends in the sharing and experience economy, LUMIIVA offers the opportunity to try experiential goods without the need to buy them. This service can also be used as a trial before purchase."

YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP LUMIIVA ENHANCE PEOPLE'S EXPERIENCES.

And the best thing about it: We transfer all of the necessary knowledge to you in order to provide you with the best experience - That means you do not have to research on the products by your own. And when you like the product, you can buy it, but when not - Just return it.INSURANCE & SAFETY: WHAT WE OFFER The products we sell provide a variety of benefits and enjoyments; But, we know that some of our products are fragile and we value the customers’ and products’ safety while enjoying the new experiences. Therefore, we offer:       Highest quality and safety guidelines for suppliers   Continuous quality and safety controls   Optional insurance cover for every package   Tips, tutorials and workshops on how to use our products HOW THE MONEY WILL BE USED               LUMIIVA TIMELINE                          Q&AQ:  What is inside each package offered?A: The product chosen plus all the necessary equipment to experience itQ: Am I limited to renting only these packages offered?A: No. We keep up with technological trends and will seek to offer the most innovative products on the market. All suggestions from our customers will be welcome, and we will work with providing products that are in popular demand.Q: I tried a gadget from LUMIIVA. Can I also buy it?A: Of course! With your collected LUMIIVA Points that you earned for your rental period, you will even get a discount on the purchase price.Q: How can I partner or work with you?A: We are open to collaborate with different businesses! Please email us at lumiiva.info@gmail.comQ: How can I get in touch with you for questions, suggestions or solely boredom?A: Just get in touch with us via lumiiva.info@gmail.com or directly via our social media links                                                      MEET THE TEAM                "LUMIIVA aims to solve a simple problem: The need to get hold of smart technology and gadgets on a temporary basis at an affordable price. Adapting to the current trends in the sharing and experience economy, LUMIIVA offers the opportunity to try experiential goods without the need to buy them. This service can also be used as a trial before purchase."YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP LUMIIVA ENHANCE PEOPLE'S EXPERIENCES.

story:
Short Summary

I grew up in the small town of Kingstree, South Carolina. My father was an entrepreneur himself and I was raised to believe that you can achieve success from your own business through hard work, ingenuity, and humor. During high school I worked in a small gift and China shop. It was always my dream to own a business like that one! 

Today, after moving away for college, I have returned to my hometown, married my high school sweetheart and we are raising our children in my family home which I inherited from my parents.

Returning to Kingstree has brought me back to my high school dream of owning my own speciality store. I chose a boutique because of my combined love of fashion and jewelry!

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $10,000 which will be used as follows:

- purchasing $8,000 of inventory to jumpstart my displays at local events in my community
- $2,000 will be devoted to marketing efforts on social media platforms

I plan to increase my business revenue by 100% within the next 6 months using this money as the kickstarter Krissy's needs to become the successful business I already know it to be.

The Impact

I decided to start my business in January of 2017 after experiencing a traumatic injury which nearly resulted in my death. I look at my time as much more valuable and want to provide a balanced work/life environment for my children.

The impacts my family will see are this will allow me to work more of a non-traditional schedule and be available to actively participate in my young children's everyday lives.

The future goal for my business is that it will flourish and provide my family with a stable income. Also, I hope to provide my daughter with real work experience while young and then give her a legacy to be proud of and want to continue when it's my time to retire.

 

Risks & Challenges

I come into a market that is flooded with competition which will make it challenging to acquire customers who may already be loyal to another boutique. To overcome this challenge I will

  • Utilize my personal network to gain clients that already know me 
  • Market heavily through social media platforms such as Facebook and Instagram... This is where my target customer lives online.
  • Offer unparalleled customer service and retain clients because of previous positive experiences

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute there are still many ways you can help!

  • Tell all your friends about my campaign
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word
  • Join my Facebook Group or like my Facebook Page and add everyone you know
  • Snag some really hot fashions through the Facebook Page and Group

story:
Dear Friends and Family, 

This December, I will be graduating from the University of Hawaii, Mānoa. Before then, I would like to help a local organization that I believe is making an impact in Hawai'i and abroad. I found this organization by chance one day when having coffee with my friend at a place called Surfer's Bar. 

This coffee shop sits on a plot of land in Wahiawa that used to be an entire row of strip clubs and XXX-stores before owner of STN, Tom Bauer, and the community worked together to create the coffee shop/breakfast/community center that it is today. When I found out they also did international trips to teach surfing, I knew I wanted to help out!

I chose Surfing the Nations because I know firsthand how sports like surfing and skating have changed my life. To be able to introduce and develop these sports in other countries would mean being able to be a part of the healing and stoke that is S&S. 

By traveling to Morocco, I could gain much insight into the future of these sports and see their response from different cultures. This experience would be my first humanitarian mission. Please help me make this trip possible! 

$1,900 would cover flight expenses shown on STN. website (not sure if this is subsidized yet). This doesn't include the $1,300 ground costs, but it is a start in the right direction and will be a great aid in helping save for this trip. This will be an "all-or-nothing" campaign, so that if I do not reach my goal in 60 days, you guys will receive your money back via the fixed funding options. :)

story:
What is it?

Give Your Heart is a campaign to both support charities for mental illnesses monetarily, as well as support those with them more physically.

All messages ("Hearts") are listed online for when people need a pick me up, and one is shipped with all shirts funded by this campaign.

How You Can Help

There are several ways you can help us:

  • Purchase a #GiveYourHeart print from Redbubble, in which all profits go to charity
  • Submit a Heart here, which could help someone who's not having a good time right now
  • Donate to this crowdfund in order to push the project into local shirt printing, saving creation costs, and giving a larger margin to charities.
  • Order a shirt from this campaign for someone you know in a difficult place right now, show them you care!

How a Heart can Help

Sometimes it's not easy to help people, sometimes it's not easy to be helped, and sometimes all you need is to hear that people care. A Heart could be how someone overcame a difficult decision, a motivational sentence, or even just a thoughtful and caring few words.

When you're depressed and feel alone, sometimes all you need is to hear that everything is going to be ok. And a few words can really help.

As Much Support As Possible

This campaign isn't 100% bulletproof. Quite often, people can reach the point where a few words aren't going to help, and that's where a larger, funded charity can help. And that's where all profits from this campaign would go.

Even if a Heart doesn't help at the time, when a shirt is shipped from this campaign, a physical and hand-written Heart comes on a handy business-card shaped card, that can be carried with you at all times.

Gather Hearts

Don't know what to say? Got no money? No problem.

You can still help, there are 7 billion people out there, that's a lot of hearts.

Spread the word, and potentially save a life.

story:
We are just 2 happy and positive persons who want to help other people to use their full potential

And we like to find same kind of people. People who want to be happy and they do anything they can to pursuit their happiness. People who are willing to help, if they can.

We would like to know your name, good people of the world!

GOD BLESS YOU!

What We Need & What You Get

We simply want to see how many positive and good people left in the world, interested in their personal development and progress. People who feel like they can achieve more, they can help more, they can contribute more, they have a higher potential.

If YOU are one of them, you may choose to donate at least 1 dollar to support our new small business for Coaching services.

Why? Simply because it is in YOUR power.

And YOU are not afraid YOU will loose 1 dollar, because YOU know that when you give, YOU receive back ten times more in the most unexpected ways.

THANK YOU so much for supporting this project! Your money will be used to help us to build our business for helping people around the world to be positive, to succeed and to have an accomplished life.

Or maybe YOU would like to improve some skills and YOU to know what books YOU can read to learn more.



Or maybe YOU feel YOU can be an entrepreneur, but YOU do not know where to start from.


Or maybe YOU want to reduce or even get away from a phobia.

Or maybe YOU want to talk to somebody who can help YOU to find YOUR own answers related to how YOU can improve YOUR life and use all YOUR potential.


What will we do with this money, no matter what amount we will manage to raise? We will keep a part of it (God only knows we really need it for our Coaching  small business we launched) and another a part (maybe 5%, maybe 10% - we will think about it), we will donate it for 2 humanitarian projects in medical and educational field.

THANK YOU! These roses are for YOU!


The Impact

YOU will simply help us to build a business for helping others.

And I hope YOU will feel YOU ARE A VERY GENEROUS AND GOOD PERSON - because YOU REALLY ARE!

NO OTHER PERSONS AND ORGANIZATIONS ARE INVOLVED IN THIS CAMPAIGN. Just YOU, a GOOD PERSON of the world, and us.

Thank YOU!

Risks & Challenges

Even if nobody in the world will care about this campaign, we will still continue to have faith in human kindness.

As you can see, we did not give you so many details related to the reasons we need this money. And maybe this will prevent you from donating here even as much as 1 dollar. But we take this risk, as we do not want to tell you a sad story, we want for YOU to be a happy donation. For us, this campaign is also like a social experiment and we are really curious who are the good persons of the world? How many they are?

Other Ways You Can Help

We perfectly understand if YOU want, but YOU cannot donate 1 dollar, as YOU do not have one to spare (and please, DO NOT DONATE if you are in this situation).

BUT YOU can still contribute and help!

And we THANK YOU in advance for getting the word out and make some noise about this campaign and using the Indiegogo share tools!

We created a dedicated Facebook page and we will update every day this Facebook page and this project here with inspirational quotes and photos just to help you to remain positive. In this way, we hope we will contribute to your happiness and even if a single person will be helped by our work, we will consider we made a difference.

And, who knows, 60 days from now we might find here 1,000 dollars. Or 10,000. Or 1,000,000 :).

We told you, we do believe in humanity!


LIKE! SHARE! DONATE!

THANK YOU ALL!

GOD BLESS YOU!

story:
Escape your boredom with Timbuktu!

Imagine, the perfect getaway for families in Virginia to take a “daycation”

· State-of-the-Art Video Arcade

· Laser Tag

· Bumper Cars

· Laser Maze Obstacle Course

· Indoor Soft-Playground and “Eye-click” interactive floor games

· Host parties in our semi-private party rooms complete with a dedicated party host and chef selected child-friendly foods served by Timbuktu Café.

· Rent the entire facility for your special occasion.

Select your donation amount and reward (perk) from the column on the right side of this screen to help us open the doors!

TimbukTu, the brainchild of proud parents who realized kids were missing resources for recreation that were not subject to seasonal availability and recognized that fun should be available ALL YEAR ROUND.

What We Need & What You Get

Banks are cheap. So we need your help.

In order to bring TimbukTu to life, we need to raise $225,000 to secure a lease and purchase the equipment that will be used at Timbuktu Entertainment Facility.

For your support you will receive special mention in a dedicated section on our premises and our website as our way of thanking you for your generosity.

But that’s not all….
We have customized LIMITED EDITION memorabilia along with 
FREE PASSES as our way of saying THANK YOU!  Never to be offered on the open market, and only available with your donation to our campaign!

The Impact

We know firsthand that in families who play together, both children and adults experience a sense of togetherness and belonging. Play offers families time to communicate and make special memories with each other. And play time gives everyone a chance to relax from the demands of life and simply enjoy each other’s company.

  • A Prime location to spend quality time rain or shine.
  • Parents don’t have to hunt for a new and different family outing.
  • High energy activities will have you coming back for more!
  • A Teen center that’s safe, drug and alcohol free and has lots of activities to keep them occupied.
  • Timbuktu will host fundraisers for local charities and non-profits, donating 10% of sales back to the non-profit organization.

Recreation is a valuable part of a well-balanced life!

Help us in this effort. Your support makes an impact and is greatly appreciated.

The Team

In an effort to keep our kids active over the years, we’ve been Karate parents, Boy Scout Den mother, Baseball coach, PTA President & Treasurer, Band Parent – oh, that’s just naming a few…


“We both noted that our local area offers little for families to do that isn’t sports related or subject to the weather, so we created one” - Leslie Rinaldi

Once we identified the need in our community for a place where families can play together, we went one step further. Over the last six years we have researched and planned what such a facility would look like and are excited to now share our idea with you.

http

“We were looking for recreational opportunities that we could bring to the families and kids in our neighborhood.” – Joseph Rinaldi


Use of Funds

Your donation and support will help us secure the bank funding needed to cover the bulk of the costs to secure and equip our location, and to hire and train the staff who will be serving you.

The entire project will cost $2.5M. In order to secure an SBA loan we must have at least 10% as a downpayment.  WE NEED YOUR HELP!

     

Our “all-or-nothing” fundraise means that if we don’t meet our goal, your donation is returned to you. We need the community to get behind us so that we can bring TimbukTu to life.


Risks & Challenges

While most businesses can start small and expand, TimbukTu must start big and invest heavily in our attractions if we are to have any chances of survival.  

That being said, all extra funding that we receive will be re-invested back into this project to make the facilities even more awesome for you!


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Donate – Give as generously as you can! Select your donation package from the right or donate any other amount! 
  • Spread the word to your friends about TimbukTu, Share our campaign through your social networks and invite them to donate so your friends don’t miss out on the free ride passes and limited edition collectables!
  • Like us on Facebook and our website to stay up-to-date on our progress!
  • Cheer us on! 

Re-post - Re-Tweet - and help us REACH OUR GOAL!

Your Support can Help Make it Happen

Spread the word. Tell all your friends!

Escape with us to 

TimbukTu

Spread the word to your friends about TimbukTu, Share our campaign through your social networks and invite them to donate so your friends don’t miss out on the free ride passes and limited edition collectables!

Like us on Facebook and our website to stay up-to-date on our progress!
Cheer us on! 

Re-post - Re-Tweet - and help us REACH OUR GOAL!
Your Support can Help Make it Happen
Spread the word. Tell all your friends!
Escape with us to TimbukTu

story:
***YOU NEED A PAYPAL ACCOUNT TO CONTRIBUTE FUNDS***


ABOUT THIS PROJECT

PURPOSE OF OUR CAMPAIGN

We both grew up in close, community type of environments. We love knowing our neighbours and the intimate feeling you get when there are more friends around. We want to provide this same type of community through Modesto. Bring people together in the most relaxing place in the Caribbean.

We have been working towards this dream before we became aware of crowd funding. This campaign allows us the unique opportunity to secure maximum occupancy before production is completed. This way we can guarantee the longevity of this dream and be able to create it for you. Our dream is to open an intimate, full service resort in beautiful Belize. In keeping with a smaller number of guests, we are able to make customer service our priority. This entire campaign exists to provide people with a relaxing quality of life that only Belize can show you. Let us do the work, you sit back and enjoy.

MODESTO DESCRIPTION

Overcrowded resorts are played out and often do not aid in relaxation. In fact, they are quite the opposite: loud, dirty environments filled with tourists on a rampage. The price of Resort commodities rise continuously, making it more and more expensive to get away every year. Their business is money, and they seek to make more constantly.

We want to show people a different type of experience that relaxes you to the fullest extent, and is ridiculously low priced. Our business is designed to share a fun and relaxing quality of life, and it doesn’t need to cost you everything you own.

With only 40, air conditioned, one bedroom/one bath cabanas onsite, our maximum occupancy will be roughly 80 people at any given time. This low number allow us to provide and maintain excellent customer service. We want our investors to be able to share in the pride, joy and relaxation together. There is room for privacy if you wish to recharge the batteries, or you can engage with the other investors and share in the sense of freedom and accomplishment.

MODESTO LOCATION

We have chosen Belize as our location for many reasons. As Canadians, It’s very appealing to have a country within the British Commonwealth that has tropical weather. It is also extremely beneficial that there is no language barrier because Belize is the only country in Central America where English is the first language. The Dollar is pegged at two to one US which means that our money is worth twice as much, and it does not fluctuate. We love the fact that Belize is completely self sufficient as a country. They do not outsource any goods or services. Everything is local. The food is always fresh and packed with nutrients as it ripens properly right here in the country. Belize is also home to the second largest barrier reef in the world. This makes for world class fishing, diving, and snorkeling. There is marine life found within the reef that cannot be found anywhere else on earth. It is truly beautiful. The reef also lessens the intensity of the waves that roll in from the Caribbean Sea. This is a big factor when it comes to being able to enjoy the water, instead of fear it. Everything is mellow.


We have travelled the whole country and once we landed in Placencia for the first time, we could just feel it. With over 26 kilometers of top rated beach front in the Caribbean, the incredibly relaxing vibe, and the fact that it is still widely unknown to many, is why we chose this location.

The village of Placencia was originally settled by Nova Scotians in the 17th century. Even after all that time, the village of Placencia has a low population of about 1500 people. There is a good number of diversity among Belize’s local residents. From Mayans, Creole, Garifuna, Mestizos and Mennonites that come together to make this country, everyone is very friendly and welcoming. Everybody waves to each other. It’s refreshing and familiar to us. Out of the entire country, 46% of the land is protected by the government, and 90% of that is all marine and wildlife reserves which make for excellent eco tourism opportunities.

Whether its zip lining through the forest, horseback riding through the mountains, or any water sport of your choice, Belize has something for everyone.

MODESTO DEVELOPMENT PROCESS

We have organized this to be an efficient and expedient process. We have a real estate developer here in Placencia that has been working with us to make sure that we can begin production the moment we get funded. When funding is acquired, the purchase of the land will take place immediately. We have 3 different options for lots of land that will provide us with the space we need to create this hideaway. These pieces of land are all ready to go. Once the funding comes, we secure the best piece of property from our options. After everything is settled, we have been informed that we can break ground within 2 months of purchasing the land. During this time, other stages of development will begin.

All forty cabanas and woodwork are being built within Belize by the Mennonites. They make an exceptional product using the beautiful Local wood that Belize has to offer. They have informed us that production can start this September and then shipped to the site with more than enough time to spare.

Another part of the project will be the construction of the Infinite pool that acts as the center piece for the main area. As everything is done locally, we have already received our quote through the Aqua Construction & Cabinet Shop. These guys are behind all of the best work in the country, and are ready to go when we are. They are also building our beautiful dock and lounge area out on the water.

The restaurant and Bar are going to be customized shipping containers Built by our friends at Giant Containers, out of Toronto, Canada. All things considered, investors should be looking at December 2016 as an opening date.

COMPANIES INVOLVED

Tigé Boats                www.tige.com

Chase Schuster, West Coast Sales Manager

Courtney Wagley, Marketing Manager

Aqua Construction & Cabinet shop        www.ambergriscaye.com/aqua

Ofel Flota, Manager

Linda Vista Lumber & Houses        www.lindavistabelize.com

Scott Varro

Builders Hardware Limited          www.buildershardwarebelize.com

Giant Containers            www.giantcontainersales.com

Andrew Lockwood, Sales Manager

Sea-Doo              www.sea-doo.ca

Renocal Architecture

Sarah Karimiavval

ReMax                www.wow-belize.com

Chris Appelbe

REWARD DESCRIPTIONS

DREAMS ON THE BEACH - ($1 or more)

We appreciate all levels of support and we know that not everyone can take advantage of this Project. For those who dream about the beach and, love our idea but cant make use of it, this tier is for you. Show some love.

ALL INCLUSIVE - (75 or more)

Three meals and unlimited beverages open to close one day!

THE FIRST 40 CLUB - ($4499 or more)

Our first 40 contributors will join us for our Grand Opening and also receive a two week stay to start our year off. The extra week is complimentary and does not count against your future stays over the next 25 years. (based on availability of course)

THE EARLY BIRD V.I.P. - ($4499 or more)

contributors get one week a year for the for the next 25 years! (based on availability of course)

THE MODESTO V.I.P. - (4999 or more)

contributors get one week a year for the for the next 25 years! (based on availability of course)

SOMETHING TO THINK ABOUT

It is amazing that so many different variables have come together once we started working towards this. The universe aligned beautifully and we worked diligently to master the process and execution. We have secured the top products, in one of the worlds most beautiful places, with some of the kindest people.  We have everyone and everything prepared, all that is required is the funding. We are very excited to bring this hideaway to investors and there is more to come down the road.  We will begin by showing you a level of comfort, fun and service that you have been searching for, tucked away on the top rated beach in all of Central America.

We have made a separate video that will serve to educate you on the things that we were unable to cover, such as the weather, safety, and everything in between. This video is at the top of the page under "Gallery".

Just like the two of us, and so many others that have come before us, you will see why no one wants to leave once they get here. Placencia is Paradise.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Considering the extensiveness of this project, we have been able to limit our risks and challenges by being thorough and meticulous. It is also a major help to us that Belize is not overdeveloped or in league with any corporations. That’s right, No Mcdonalds or Wall-Mart anywhere in the country. Everything is local and that is what helps to guarantee our success. Everything is quality made. We are working with the people of the community and country to help us create this beautiful retreat. We have met or talked with all of our companies several times. We have built good relationships which helps in guarantee our success. They are ready to go when we are. The low cost of building materials and local labor will allow us to rebuild immediately should an act of god take place.

***YOU NEED A PAYPAL ACCOUNT TO CONTRIBUTE FUNDS***ABOUT THIS PROJECT
PURPOSE OF OUR CAMPAIGN

We both grew up in close, community type of
environments. We love knowing our neighbours and the intimate feeling you get
when there are more friends around. We want to provide this same type of
community through Modesto. Bring people together in the most relaxing place in
the Caribbean.We have been working towards this dream
before we became aware of crowd funding. This campaign allows us the unique
opportunity to secure maximum occupancy before production is completed. This
way we can guarantee the longevity of this dream and be able to create it for
you. Our dream is to open an intimate, full service resort in beautiful Belize.
In keeping with a smaller number of guests, we are able to make customer
service our priority. This entire campaign exists to provide people with a
relaxing quality of life that only Belize can show you. Let us do the work, you
sit back and enjoy.
MODESTO DESCRIPTION

Overcrowded resorts are played out and
often do not aid in relaxation. In fact, they are quite the opposite: loud,
dirty environments filled with tourists on a rampage. The price of Resort
commodities rise continuously, making it more and more expensive to get away
every year. Their business is money, and they seek to make more constantly. 
We want to show people a different type of
experience that relaxes you to the fullest extent, and is ridiculously low
priced. Our business is designed to share a fun and relaxing quality of life,
and it doesn’t need to cost you everything you own.
With only 40, air conditioned, one bedroom/one
bath cabanas onsite, our maximum occupancy will be roughly 80 people at any
given time. This low number allow us to provide and maintain excellent customer
service. We want our investors to be able to share in the pride, joy and
relaxation together. There is room for privacy if you wish to recharge the
batteries, or you can engage with the other investors and share in the sense of
freedom and accomplishment.

story:
RetroShed Creative Workspace - Johannesburg, South Africa

Hi, I'm Sarel (but everybody calls me Buks, pronounced BUCKS). And that's Sancia, my loving wife, and Michelle. The video above is the result of our social initiative attached to our new start up, RetroShed.

We're opening up our very first creative coworking space, RetroShed, in the heart of Johannesburg, South Africa. We've put everything we love and own into our 1700 sq ft space, but now we need your help to get it up and running like a "creative before a deadline".

RetroShed will be more than a coworking space with a hip freelancing workforce, kickass coffee, comfortable executive chairs and up cycled furniture, it will be a space where you can grow your business with like minded individuals as your support system and cheerleaders (not actual cheerleaders, but maybe we can organise). 

RetroShed will also be giving back to the community. We will host free workshops offered to students/young entrepreneurs that have big ideas and ambitions, but no experience in the world of startups, marketing, pitching and funding. WHY? It's the right thing to do and everyone could use an "AquaMan" in their lives.  Probably the worst example.

Our Journey

Buks: After slaving away for 7 years for a global advertising agency and many smaller boutique agencies, I found myself demotivated, run down and quite frankly a nervous wreck. The system the 'MAN' had created wasn't for me, there had to be a better way to do business.

We, Sancia and I, started Autonomous Republic (AR), an independent advertising agency and two years later it's still going strong. The name came from the deep seated need that we all have to be free to govern ourselves.

It's that need that spawned RetroShed.

Sancia:  After working in various large and small advertising agencies after the last 5 years, I have felt as though a dream had been crushed. What I thought would be an industry suited for a young mother ended up being a complete nightmare. I dreamt of making a difference in the world and the "real" world of agency life didn't allow for that. I did not conform to the nature of the industry - but I still strived to create a change and have done so today. 

My husband Sarel and I started AR to change the industry standard and to actually create a difference, while supporting other freelancers in our industry. We have seen daily through AR, how small creative businesses struggle in South Africa. They have no funds, no support and small client leads. 

This sparked our co-working space where we realised that a fully serviced space of like minded individuals can result in more work, more leads and better results. 

Michelle: 14 years ago, I decided to leave my home town and take a leap into the big world. I moved to Johannesburg, with a suit case and one set of bedding, not knowing what will be waiting for me on the other side. 14 years later, I find myself grown up and still in Joburg. I’ve worked for numerous big ad agencies and felt it was no longer for me as I had outgrown it. 

I decided to join two people very near and dear to my heart (Sancia & Buks). They have been an inspiration and I believe in their idea of a coworking space to unite everyone, I’ve left the big world of advertising as we know it, to help make their dream come true. 

So what do we need?

We've set out to create a space that provides top quality service with no hidden costs or catches. The transparency is easy, it's the quality that's expensive.

We've raised $30k and invested it furniture, a generator, decor, security, electrical, etc. Check out our progress in the updates or on our Facebook page. We need $30k need to be pay back our loans before we see a profit, and that will take a while even if we fill the space with paying members. We need an extra $10k to finish the job. A lot has been completed through bootstrapping and the help of the bank of mom and dad. I might have to sell my car to get this done, so please contribute. Below was the initial proposal for the funds, but we've had to make compromises along the way.

  • $5k will go towards a sustainable green power solution to give our members the advantage of never having downtime during load shedding (our national electricity provider, Eskom,  is unreliable and that is a major detriment to small business men and women).
  • $15k to cover the tech, furniture, decor, boardroom partitioning, sound proof booth (for those annoying phone calls that nobody else wants to hear) and lastly a 500-in-1 Retro Arcade Game Machine.
  • $12k to cover the first 3 months rent and expenses.
  • $3k to cover marketing activities for the first 3 months.
  • Spread the word like a peanut butter and jelly sandwich! The more nuts the better.

What's in it for you?

We're an exceptionally proud bunch, we don't want donations, so we have retro inspired perks in return for you helping RetroShed becoming an awesome place to incubate creatives and entrepreneurs. 

The Perks include:

  • We have a wall of honour. Get your name onto it for only $5 and we'll send you a personal thank you email as well as a photo of it.
  • We have awesome original retro artwork and 8bit game inspired perks: posters, sticker sheets, Laptop Skins, T-shirts, Hoodies, iPhone Skins, Notebook and pens,  Laptop Bags, Back Packs etc.
  • RetroShed branded gear: Laptop Bags, Back Packs, Stress Reliever balls and flat pack Laptop Stands.
  • Day Passes (Excluding Travel, Accommodation, Visas etc.), Yearly and Monthly Memberships (Excluding Travel, Accommodation, Visas etc.).
  • We are also offering five 3hour Skype Brainstorms with Autonomous Republic (check out our work, www.arepublic.co.za) for all your advertising and creative challenges and needs.

How your contribution will help us?

Firstly, your contribution will jumpstart our project and get us faster into a position where we can give back to the community.

Our economy, including most of the world's, needs more small businesses. So, if we can affect change in however small the difference, then we're heading in the right direction.

We have tons of ideas to make happen: apps, E-commerce websites and charities we want to build, some our own and some businesses we want to help out. Getting our first fully crowdfunded idea up, RetroShed, will give us more spark to get the other ideas out of the "plans for world domination" closet.

What are the risks and challenges for us?

There are great challenges ahead of us, especially in the form of paying back the loans we took to setup already, but we have some leeway with that as those people only require to start seeing returns from November, 2015, onwards. To break even we need 10 people in the space on a full time basis, and with it being so central to creative hubs, business and residential districts, we don't foresee that as being an unobtainable goal. Our first post on Facebook, received 10 leads the day it was posted.

The risks are greater, having invested our savings and acquisitions of loans, there is no room for error. Autonomous Republic will be operating from the space and paying it's share of the rent, what it can afford, so the required amount to break even is less, and AR is doing exceptionally well at the moment with the 2nd and 3rd quarter being our most busy times of the year, the timing is right to start RetroShed.

All these risks and challenges do not affect the perks as it will be treated separately from our loan and rental commitments. PERKS MUST BE FULFILLED. We don't need trolls.

Having a combined 44 years hospitality, production, advertising and marketing experience, we are the right people to get the job done. We believe that no obstacle is impossible, with the right mindset, preparation and systems in place, we can only succeed. There is no other choice but forward.

Other ways you can help...

We appreciate that some of you won't be able to help us out with a contribution. That's OK, we still really appreciate you taking the time to learn more about what we're doing. 

You can still really help us in the following ways:

  • Share is caring. Share our campaign on social media (using the buttons on the bottom).
  • Email your friends, family and work colleagues with the link to this page! 
  • 'LIKE' our Facebook page and 'Share' posts about the campaign! https://www.facebook.com/pages/RetroShed/897661476924624?ref=hl
  • Talk to people about it! Word of mouth is the most powerful form of marketing.

Hopefully with your help, we'll be able to make this a reality and you'll always be welcome to come down and see us at RetroShed!
Any questions? Leave them under the comments section, or email us at info@retroshed.co.za

Thank you for your consideration.

Having a combined 44 years hospitality, production, advertising and marketing experience, we are the right people to get the job done. We believe that no obstacle is impossible, with the right mindset, preparation and systems in place, we can only succeed. There is no other choice but forward.

Other ways you can help...
We appreciate that some of you won't be able to help us out with a contribution. That's OK, we still really appreciate you taking the time to learn more about what we're doing. 
You can still really help us in the following ways:

Share is caring. Share our campaign on social media (using the buttons on the bottom).

Email your friends, family and work colleagues with the link to this page! 

'LIKE' our Facebook page and 'Share' posts about the campaign! https://www.facebook.com/pages/RetroShed/897661476924624?ref=hl


Talk to people about it! Word of mouth is the most powerful form of marketing.
Hopefully with your help, we'll be able to make this a reality and you'll always be welcome to come down and see us at RetroShed!

Any questions? Leave them under the comments section, or email us at info@retroshed.co.za
Thank you for your consideration.

story:
"Be the change you want to see in the world" - Ghandi
_______________________________________________________________

In 2010, Mathieu Paquette traveled to Senegal to see first-hand the country’s development needs. It was clear that access to water was a rampant challenge; throughout his travels, it became clear that water was the foundational unit for every sectors of society to thrive. With a mission at hand to help, he started ADHQ. Since 2010, and with the help of many volunteers, ADHQ has helped develop two main villages Ndiaye-Diaye and Bantantinti.

By providing water infrastructure and involving as many people from local community as possible, the projects have yielded awesome results:

-Over 6,000 rural citizens with access to drinking water. 
-More than 10,000 hours of volunteer work in orphanages in Mbour , Senegal.
-Medical equipment in remote areas Contribution in which more than 30,000 syringes. 

The domino effect is obvious. Having access to drinking water lessens overall health problems, boosts agricultural growth and economy, thus allowing for more stable income, leading to access to the health care. From the women’s perspective, water transcends other dimensions of emancipation. Since women are responsible for water supply, it is not uncommon for women to go long distances to get water.

Having access to water means women spend more time at home with their family, develop less physical health problems related to heavy collection of water and perhaps more time to get involved in a microenterprise created by water accessibility Because of volunteers and a growing collective consciousness, ADHQ has been able to create ripples in Senegal, but now we strive to create waves. 

 How to help ADHQ

 _____________________________________________________________________________
ADHQ next phase is to collect 10 000$ to install new water infrastructure and a new Flourmill to boost local economy. Invest in the welfare of the people of Senegal and contribute to the professional development of the people of Quebec. Helping out ADHQ doesn’t just help out our friends abroad but also invests in the training of our future professionals.
ADHQ also wants to install a solar flour mill to relieve the women of this very difficult task. In addition, these women will be trained and responsible for the operation of the equipment and this by the creation of a small food processing cooperative.

ADHQ works in collaboration with the department of Engineering at Sherbrooke Cégep to give opportunity to students to install and design water equipment in Senegal. 

What will we do with the money?

The money raised will be used to replace the existing filtration equipment at Ndiaye-N'Diaye village in Ndiaganiao. Donations to indigo will be used on transportation expenses, filtration and solar flour mill equipment exclusively.

  •  Make a donation via internet (https://www.jedonneenligne.org/csi/frm_detail.php?FrmUID=18.)
  • Share our fundraising on social media
  • Share our Facebook page (Development Action Humanitarian ADHQ Quebec )
  • Get involved with our organization 
  • Become involved as volunteers directly in Senegal

*****IMPORTANT******
If you want to receive a tax receipt, it is primordial to use our online plateform. For more details contact us.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Action-de-D%C3%A9veloppement-Humanitaire-du-Qu%C3%A9bec-ADHQ-158870144280154/

ADHQ: Non-Profit organization #1169036796 in partnership with the NGO Carrefour de Solidarité Internationale de Sherbrooke #11883 9679 RR001

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

                                     
             "Soyez le changement que vous voulez voir dans le monde" - Ghandi 

En 2010, Mathieu Paquette voyage le Sénégal afin de mieux comprendre les enjeux de développement ainsi que les problématiques freinant ce développement, Plus les rencontres se multipliaient, plus la situation s’éclaircissait. Les citoyens vivant en région éloignée avaient le même discours, l'eau potable manque. C'est à ce moment que l'idée de créer un organisme de coopération internationale fût mise sur la table. 

En donnant accès à des infrastructures et en intégrant le plus possible la communauté visée, les projets de l'ADHQ ont atteints des résultats incroyables. 
- Plus de 6000 citoyens ont accès à de l'eau potable. 
- Plus de 10 000 heures de bénévolat dans un orphelinat de Mbour.
- Contribution significatif en matériel médical auprès des cases de santé (village) dont plus de 30 000 seringues.

L'effet domino se fait sentir. Avoir accès à l'eau potable c'est la santé, c'est aussi la possibilité de faire de l'agriculture, de faire de l'argent, de réinvestir les profits, de pouvoir s'offrir des soins de santé.  Du point de vue de la femme, l'accessibilité à l'eau fait état de l'émancipation. Depuis toujours, les femmes sont responsables de l'approvisionnement en eau, il n'est pas rare de les voir marcher quelques kilomètres afin d'avoir accès à de l'eau de qualité. 

Avoir accès à l'eau potable facilement signifie que les femmes peuvent passer plus de temps avec leurs enfants, qu'elles développent moins de problèmes physiques liés à la cueillette de l'eau et souvent leur donne le temps de s'investir dans nos projets, en créant des collectifs de femmes. 

Grâce à nos bénévoles, à l'évolution de la conscience collective ainsi qu'à ses multiple partenariats/collaborations, l'ADHQ possède maintenant un pouvoir d'action plus important que jamais sur le terrain.

Comment aider l'ADHQ
 ____________________________________________________________________________

La prochaine phase de développement de l'ADHQ consiste à collecter 10,000$CAD afin d'installer de nouveaux équipements de filtration  plus performant dans un de nos projets existant, ce qui pourra augmenter la quantité d'eau récolté ainsi que de développer de plus grands projets d'agriculture dans le village. De plus, nous voulons installer un moulin à farine solaire ayant la capacité de moudre 2 tonnes de farine par jour. 

l'ADHQ veut aussi installer un moulin à farine solaire afin de soulager les femmes de cette tâche très difficile. De plus, ces femmes seront formés et en charge du bon fonctionnement de ces installations et ce par la création d'une petite coopérative de transformation des aliments. 

Donner de l'argent à l'ADHQ, c'est non seulement contribuer à l'avancement des populations des communautés rurales du Sénégal, mais c'est aussi développer les compétences des jeunes et futurs professionnels d'ici.

En effet, les équipements acheminés au Sénégal (filtration d'eau et moulin à farine) sont créés par des étudiants du département de Génie Mécanique et Technique de Maintenance Industrielle du Cégep de Sherbrooke. 


Que ferons-nous avec l'argent amassé?

L'argent amassé sera dédié au remplacement des équipements de filtration et à l'installation d'un moulin à farine solaire dans le village de Ndiaye-Diaye, Ndiaganiao. Seul les frais de déplacements serons assumés. Aucun salaire ne sera déduis de la récolte de dons d'Indiegogo. 


Nous aider concrètement

  • Faire un don ici, sur Indiegogo 
  • Faire un don via notre plate-forme de don en ligne (https://www.jedonneenligne.org/csi/frm_detail.php?FrmUID=18.)
  • Partager notre campagne de financement sur les médias sociaux
  • Partager notre page Facebook (Action de Développement Humanitaire du Québec)
  • Vous impliquer dans notre organisme au Canada 
  • Devenir bénévoles dans l'un de nos projets au Sénégal

******IMPORTANT******

Si vous désirez obtenir un crédit d'impôt, vous devez absolument utiliser notre plate-forme de don en ligne mentionnée plus haut.


Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Action-de-D%C3%A9veloppement-Humanitaire-du-Qu%C3%A9bec-ADHQ-158870144280154/

ADHQ: Non-Profit organization #1169036796en partenariat avec le Carrefour de Solidarité Internationale de Sherbrooke #11883 9679 RR001

story:
¿Contarías todos tus secretos al vecino del 7º?

No, ¿verdad? entonces ¿porque no te aseguras de mostrar la información solo a quien tu quieres?
Solks te permite esa clasificación, permitiendo que sus objetos muestren información diferente según la persona que lo lea:

Pulsera para niños en un colegio:

  • El personal del colegio verá el contacto de los padres
  • El personal de comedor verá las alergias alimentarias del niño.
  • El personal sanitario verá posibles enfermedades/medicación, etc
  • Y personal externo, un formulario para contactar en caso de extravío del niño.
Mascota:

  • El veterinario vería todo el historial
  • Mi familia vería siguiente fecha de vacunación
  • Y una persona externa vería cómo contactar con el dueño en caso de extravío.

Llavero:

  • Al dueño, le mostraría si pertenecen a la casa de la playa, a la oficina, etc
  • A una persona externa, le diría como contactar con el dueño.

Pulsera de Velcro para deportistas:

  • En caso de emergencias, mostraría tus datos sanitarios mas importantes, alergias a medicamentos, grupo sanguíneo, contactos de emergencia, nº de tarjeta sanitaria, etc

¡Ah! y además en todos los casos, tus objetos te podrían avisar cuando los lean y en que localización han hecho la lectura.


Responsabilidad Social

En NGWOTA tenemos la visión de que el mundo puede ser mejor gracias a la tecnología, eliminando barreras físicas, intelectuales y sociales. Ésto queda reflejado en el icono , ya que parte del beneficio lo destinaremos a estos colectivos.

Estamos desarrollando una gama de productos, creada por colectivos en riesgo de exclusión para favorecer su integración y puedes participar en este desarrollo a través de nuestro concurso.

Para la producción responsable, nos hemos asociado con
  • Fundación Dalma: http://www.fundaciondalma.org/es/

Fundación Dalma trabaja para la integración social de personas con riesgo de exclusión mediante la creación de proyectos sostenibles. www.conturegalo.org es un Centro Especial de Empleo donde todo su equipo tiene algún tipo de discapacidad y cuyo objetivo es ayudar a la integración social, comercializando los artículos realizados en más de 60 talleres de inserción en toda España.

  • Fundación Apadema: http://www.apadema.es


Colabora con la producción solidaria de pulseras.


Resellers / Revendedores

Al comprar grandes cantidades, obtienes un precio mejor, y son ideales para colegios, residencias, etc, para empezar a gestionar comunidad tu propia comunidad de Solks

 

¿Para que sirve Solks?

La visualizacion de datos de los productos Solks, se basa en perfiles y grupos, por ejemplo para controlar:

Residencias de Ancianos:



Escuelas:


Playas





Prototipos

Contamos con los primeros prototipos de los productos. La versión final podrá variar respecto a la mostrada en la fotografías.

Pulseras de Silicona


Pulseras de Velcro

Colgante para Identificar Objetos:

Chapa para Mascotas:

Pulsera Responsable

(Todas las fotos tienen borrado el código QR por seguridad)


Fecha de envío y stock

  • Estimada: Octubre 2016 (lista para la campaña de Navidad)
  • Haremos todo lo posible por mejorar estas fechas, aunque ya disponemos de un stock de varios cientos de unidades que enviaremos a los primeros compradores

¿Y esto que prometemos, se puede hacer?

Ya está hecho :)

Podéis visitar qr.solks.com y empezar a crear vuestra cuenta y a disfrutar de todas las funcionalidades Solks. La página está aún en versión beta y estamos trabajando en emocionantes nuevas funcionalidades que esperamos poder ofrecer en el futuro como:

Integración con Facebook, para poder personalizar el contenido que verán tus amigos de Facebook

IoT, sí, el universal Internet of Things, o dicho de otra forma, conseguir controlar dispositivos y que se comuniquen con nosotros. La primera beta verá la luz en cuestión de semanas. Podrás crear (con beaglebones, raspberry pi...) y adquirir dispositivos increíbles hechos en comunidad Solks como alarmas domésticas que permitan a tus padres controlarla cuando no estés y que tu vecino de confianza reciba la alarma, también podrás hacer que se ilumine el corazón de un peluche cuando tu pareja escanee el código, o que puedas regar las plantas sin estar en casa.

.... y más sorpresas que irán viniendo, tú haces Solks y nos ayudas a crear un futuro mejor

Concurso Videos Solks

Hemos lanzado un concurso en redes sociales para que la gente nos ayude a descubrir que se puede hacer con Solks. 


Que pasa si no se llega al objetivo?

Este crowdfunding lo hacemos con financiacion flexible, por lo que todas las recompensas encargadas/compradas, serán enviadas en la fecha indicada arriba.

Los productos los tenemos terminados y la plataforma online de gestion de los mismos, tambien.

La plataforma Solks, garantiza, que todos los productos adquiridos actualmente, serán compatibles con futuras actualizaciones de Solks.


Comparte

Ayúdanos a alcanzar nuestro objetivo compartiendo este crowdfunding con los links de abajo!!

story:
This campaign was unsuccessful in raising its funds.
We chose to create a "fixed" campaign versus a "flexible" one.

This means that in the event that our campaign didn't meet our goal, all of the funds raised would be reimbursed to the contributors.

So our campaign didn't meet our goal. Unfortunately IndieGoGo staff refuse to let us take down our campaign. For what? What purpose does an unsuccessful campaign serve? Absolutely NO purpose. So we can only suffice that they want us to be the example of an unsuccessful campaign. IndieGoGo therefore are totally in the wrong. We did not sign up for this sort of harassment!

story:
Our Story

Two Brothers.  West African and West Indies lineage.  West Philly bred.

We love everything about beer.  The ingredients. The smell. The taste. The Process. Over the years our pride and passion has grown for crafting unique and flavorful beer.  Our hometown of Philadelphia has shown us much love and we believe it is time to scale to a commercial sized brewery with a taproom and event space. To show our appreciation for your contribution we have exclusive perks at different funding tiers for all budgets.  Show your support for local and minority owned businesses by contributing today.  At the moment, we are open to investments.  If you would like to inquire about investing you can contact us at 2localsbrewing@gmail.com. 

Two Locals was all a fantasy until one day we ordered a 1 gallon brew kit from Northern Brewer.  We made an Irish Red Ale.  After that, we took a nose dive into the brewing world.  We brewed almost every weekend in Mengistu’s backyard trying to perfect a handful of beers. We began sharing our beers with friends and family. Eventually, we started to take our beers to various local events to receive feedback.  As our confidence grew, we started thinking, "What if we had our own brewery?" We’ve always felt that if we can make good beer as home brewers then imagine what we could do with the quality control of a brewery.

 

WITH YOUR HELP, WE CAN BRING TWO LOCALS BREWING COMPANY TO PHILADELPHIA!

 

During the many nights of staying up late to learn about the brewing process, brewing techniques and the beer industry, we noticed there is a need for more minority brewers and breweries.  After more research, we discovered the city of Philadelphia has never had a black owned brewery! So, why not us?

We feel that representation is important and this brewery will be an example for others to have confidence stepping into a space where they may not feel represented. Become the representation you want to see and be the change you want to see.  Our brewery will be an experience you won't find anywhere else in Philadelphia.  Our brewery will bring people together in a space that celebrates culture, music, and the arts.   What pairs better with that than great vibes and great beer!?

 

 

With your contribution, you will become part of the a "Two Locals’ Founder’s Club"!  Only YOU will have access to the special edition merchandise!

 

Knowledge is Power

We are on a mission to change the image of craft beer.  The Brewers Association has implemented various programs to help promote diversity in the craft beer industry over the past couple years. In 2018, the Brewers Association reported that of the 7,300 breweries in the U.S., 3.4% were owned by people of color.  1% African American and 2.4% Hispanic or Latino.  In the state of Pennsylvania there is only one other black owned brewing company. With your help we can make it TWO!

 

We have spent countless hours doing whatever we can to gain knowledge about the brewing process, brewing techniques, and the business.  We joined the Philadelphia Homebrew Club to hone our brewing techniques and receive critiques on beers.  With the knowledge we gained from the homebrew club, we were able to develop a recipe, which is our Nubian Brown Ale, that won us second place at a local homebrew competition. 

 

We understand that brewing at home and brewing in a brewery are completely different.  We are committed to learning as much as we can to be as successful as we can.  On the professional level, we have spent days in the brewery of Love City Brewing Company shadowing them during the brewing and cleaning processes and asking every question that comes to mind.  Love City Brewing Company has been essential to the development of us as both brewers and entrepreneurs. 

 

 

Teamwork Makes the Dream work!

Opening a brewery is extremely expensive and not easily accomplished.  Although we have the commitment of a couple investors, they are not enough.  We are asking for your help to raise $75,000 to assist with the cost of various equipment for the brewery and taproom, kegs and keg washer, legal fees, building a cold box, and help purchase ingredients to brew. 

 

Your contribution will prove there is a desire for more craft beer in our city,  the support of local businesses, as well as minority owned businesses, and the want for a space that is for the community and committed to building up the communities of Philadelphia.

 

We love the city of Philadelphia and the people in it.  Philadelphia made us who we are today.  Philadelphia is one of the largest craft beer cities in the country.  When we think of beer we think about having a fun time with people you love and having great conversations.  We think about sporting events and music concerts.  Our dream is to use this brewery not only as a means to bring people together but as a way to give back to the communities of Philadelphia and create a space that represents the arts and cultures of Philadelphia.

 

Share

We understand that not everyone can give, but you can still help in a big way! 

Please sign up for updates and events, share, like, and repost on Instagram, Facebook and/or Twitter! Word of mouth is powerful and can make a huge difference and we greatly appreciate it! When posting please remember to tag us @twolocals on Instagram and @twolocalsbrewing on Facebook! #TwoLocalsBrewing.

 

THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! in advance for helping us bring this brewery to the City of Philadelphia and the surrounding community!
